I am trying to use `Distributed` on an “expensive” function `f` (takes minutes or hours to run) that requires an input from a matrix (in particular a row). In serial:
```for u0 in eachrow(mymat)
    f(u0) # the function saves some data to a file
end```
It seems turning the for loop into @distributed is not the ideal approach as the docs say this is better for inexpensive functions. It then refers me to `pmap` . How can I use pmap in this context. Something like this doesn’t work
```pmap(f(u0),u0 in eachrow(mymat), distributed=false)```
